children.name: Economy
children.info: The burst of the housing bubble led to a Great Recession and a sudden financial crisis. Questions about economic policy, plans for recovery, and government bailouts were central in this election.

children.name: Taxes
children.info: Obama and McCain proposed different tax plans - with the Republicans favoring tax cuts all across the board, while Democrats favored tax cuts more favorable to low income groups.

children.name: Healthcare
children.info: Obama favored a national health insurance program as well as expanding Medicaid; while McCain opposed federal legislation, arguing that greater competition would lead to lower costs and higher coverage.

children.name: Drugs
children.info: Obama favored reducing drug sentencing disparities, as well as opposed the term "War on Drugs", a largely unsuccessful campaign. Issues of criminal justice reform were also brought to light.

children.name: Energy
children.info: The importance of combating global warming was gaining traction, and the general consensus was that the United States was too dependent on imported oil and gas. Candidates this year proposed differing ways to reduce that burden.

children.name: Terrorism
children.info: Many Americans opposed the ground war in Iraq, and the government was now proposing ways to conduct the war on terror through intelligence and data-gathering, with proposals for new diplomacy commissions.

children.name: War & Peace
children.info: The Iraq War was a major source of contention this year. The war was extremely expensive, both in terms of money and casualties, and many Americans wanted promises of removing troops.

children.name: LGBT Rights
children.info: The military's "Don't Ask, Don't Tell" policy for the LGBT community was brought into question. While both candidates opposed same-sex marriage, Obama favored civil unions and gay adoption.

children.name: Infrastructure & Technology
children.info: Candidates discussed space capabilities, especially in relation to reliance on foreign space exploration. The development of stem cell research was also supported on both sides.

children.name: Middle East
children.info: In the aftermath of 9/11, tensions in the Middle East grew. This election saw discussion surrounding the Iraq War, the Afghanistan War, and the possibility of Iran developing nuclear weapons.
